Posts.Content: how weird you mention the red face, up very early this morning and when hubby came downstairs he asked me what was wrong with my face as it was bright red! DD
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: A bit of advice please from those who are further along the chemo path than me. Round 2 of FEC next week, can I expect the SE to be similar to round one or can I expect them to be worse. Like to be prepared DD
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: So here I am continuing my Chemo journey and will be until at least March. So far so good, Monday was awful and I wanted to stop the world and get off but woke up Tuesday fine. Having the daily stomach injections (finished Thursday) and developed the most awful backache which eased with Paracetamol and a heat pad. So all in all doing ok. Could've done without the bathroom ceiling falling in last night, roof must be leaking and been for a while, well after the rain we have had here for the last few days enough was enough and down it has come...can I find the house insurance documents....nope   oh well DD
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: HI Mrs 50 I followed advice from her re my injections. The first one I had really stung, so asked and was told to take it out of the fridge 30 mins before giving, this made all the difference. Gave them early evening. No aches until day 6 when I had really bad lower back pain. This eased with Paracetamol although the effects of that didnt last 6 hours, so used my heated wheat bag which was great. Backache went the day after my last injection. The really good thing is that the injections are spring loaded, and so once you have pushed the button the jab is given and the needle retracts, much better than having to push the plunger down yourself. You will be fine and who knows you may get brave enough to give them yourself, good luck  DDx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi all, New symptom today, hiccups!! much to my husbands amusement. Have been having terrible indigestion and finally got some Omeprazole from my GP, taken one with little effect yet, but these hiccups can do one. Hubby getting his clippers out tonight as my poor hair is thinning on top going to be one of those memorable husband/wife moments DD
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Welcome Rumcat, sorry you find yourself here but know there is plenty of support for you. The first thing you need to do is to take a deep breath. There is no such thing as a stupid question. Worth writing down anything that you want to know, you want to know what treatment you are going to have, how often, possible side effects, how this will affect your home life, work life. Also feel free to ask questions on here, you will get so much useful advice and guidance. Please dont feel you are alone we are all here for you  DD
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: DaisyDoo I found using a heated wheat bag really helped the back pain. sorry it didn't go to plan, but onward and upwards  DD
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Mrs50 So far so good. had my first chemo just over 2 weeks ago. Had one bad day which was day 6 (couldnt get comfortable, very restless and apparently I looked very pale.) But woke up the next day and I was fine. I get tired very easily, but just obey my body. If it says rest then I rest. I set myself small goals to achieve, Had a sore throat on day 5 again eased with Paracetamol, kept an eye on my temperature which was fine.  Seen the Oncologist this morning who is happy with how things are going. So as long as my bloods are ok on Monday I shall be having round 2 next Weds. Oh and my hair started to come out this morning but I was ready for that.  IF you have any questions just ask on here, there is no such thing as a daft question DD
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Had my first round of FEC nearly three weeks ago. Hair started to come out on Friday and more and more has come out over the weekend, this morning in the shower it looked like a massacre had taken place with hair rather than blood..I can see hubby getting his clippers out in the next few days. Bloods taken this morning so fingers crossed I am fit enough for the next round. Need to sort out a wig I think DD
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Wanting to wish you all a Merry Christmas. Fingers crossed the side effects are kind to you tomorrow DD
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Likewise I had a Picc fitted (normal for the trust I go to). I am lucky my local District Nurses do Picc Line flush so I go weekly to my local clinic rather than the 50+ mile round trip to the hospital. I am having my third FEC on Weds and then onto to the Herceptin and (something else - not sure what yet)...take it a day at a time, try and remain positive, and see 2019 as the year you kick cancers butt.  DD
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Likewise I had a Picc fitted (normal for the trust I go to). I am lucky my local District Nurses do Picc Line flush so I go weekly to my local clinic rather than the 50+ mile round trip to the hospital. I am having my third FEC on Weds and then onto to the Herceptin and (something else - not sure what yet)...take it a day at a time, try and remain positive, and see 2019 as the year you kick cancers butt.  DD
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: I found having dark nail varnish helped with my finger and toe nails whilst on Docetaxel. Saw it recommended on here and have had no issues. I may have been one of the lucky ones and not suffered anyway but you never know. Didnt need any anti sickness whilst on the Docetaxel but the steroids were a nightmare and really affected my sleep. Make sure you take the afternoon dose before 4pm or you will definitely spend much of the night awake. Be prepared for the fatigue. Cant believe how tired i got but again that may just be me. My taste changed more as well, and fluids I could taste and tolerate were different than when I was on FEC. Couldnt bear anything fizzy either DD
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Well I should’ve had my last chemo yesterday but after a stay at hotel NHS for an infection last week my oncologist decided 5 rounds were enough, so I step off the chemo bus but continue with Herceptin until January next year...feels like forever, also going to start Anastrazole in a couple of weeks once I have finished my antibiotics.  I have a couple of questions for those who have finished their chemo journey.  1. When can I expect my hair to start growing back and is there anything I can take to promote healthy strong regrow this.  2. Do I need to get any special sunscreen to apply as I am aware my skin is going to be super sensitive to the sun And I want to be prepared DD
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: So I finished my Chemo 4 weeks ago, although still having Herceptin every three weeks. This past couple of days I have felt wiped out, so tired. I am sleeping really well at night but wake up exhausted and falling asleep during the day if I sit down for any length of time. Is this normal? is this just my body doing what it needs to do? any idea how long this lasts DD
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: I had this done in October, home from hospital the next day. The worst bit for me was that they like to keep the area well heated for the first 12 hours post op so you are kept under what looks like a lilo with hot air running continuously through it...nurses were really great and managed to site it so it was just across my chest and kept the rest of my body clear. I had 2 drains in situ, one came out after three days the other after six. It took a few weeks for me to sleep on my left side (side I had the procedure on) but could sleep on my right side once I had the drains out, although it did pull a bit. You have to wear your bra day and night for six weeks which helped. Happy to answer anymore of your questions.
Posts.Title: Reconstruction using back muscle, anyone else??

Posts.Content: No I didn’t need an implant as well as I was quite well endowed. In fact I will be having a reduction on the other side at the end of the year. They took some skin from my back and grafted it onto the front and when I have the reduction they are going to make a nipple out of that transplanted skin, so still a work in progress I am afraid. So currently needing my little friend in my bra still.
Posts.Title: Reconstruction using back muscle, anyone else??

Posts.Content: Will be thinking of you tomorrow The Script Fan, we are all here if you need us hope it all goes well xx
Posts.Title: Reconstruction using back muscle, anyone else??

Posts.Content: Hi The script Fan Hope things went well today and you got some answers. I did not experience any hardness but do get the occasional  muscle twinge, I was warned about this beforehand. It feels a bit weird but prior warning has helped not make it a big deal. Doing the exercises help and keep on with them, I am 6 months post op now and everything feels like it is tightening up and becoming more normal but I kn ow I have to keep things moving. Finally going back to work next Monday so that will help ( had 5 rounds of Chemo since the surgery hence the delay in going back) DD
Posts.Title: Reconstruction using back muscle, anyone else??

Posts.Content: My Mastectomy and reconstruction was operation no 4 last year so that side had already taken quite a battering. No issues with my arm, just do the exercises as they tell you. Not noticed any weakness just a slight pulling across my back when I stretch up and this is along the suture line but this has also improved, do get the occasional ache across my back but nothing I cant cope with. I hardly need any painkillers after the surgery just for the first 48 hours and then I was fine, but we are all different. If you feel that you need them then take them. Oh and rest it is major surgery although the quick discharge may make you think its not but trust me it is..look after yourself and always around if you need to ask questions. I am sure you will be fine the build up is the nightmare
Posts.Title: Reconstruction using back muscle, anyone else??

Posts.Content: Hi The script Fan Hope things went well today and you got some answers. I did not experience any hardness but do get the occasional  muscle twinge, I was warned about this beforehand. It feels a bit weird but prior warning has helped not make it a big deal. Doing the exercises help and keep on with them, I am 6 months post op now and everything feels like it is tightening up and becoming more normal but I kn ow I have to keep things moving. Finally going back to work next Monday so that will help ( had 5 rounds of Chemo since the surgery hence the delay in going back) DD
Posts.Title: Reconstruction using back muscle, anyone else??

Posts.Content: I was told last Friday that I have to have Chemo...devastated is not an understatement. It hadnt been mentioned at all to date. I have had 4 surgeries since June and was told I would need radiotherapy so I was prepared for that but not Chemo. I have 2 weeks to decide if its a route I want to go down and I am all over the place. I am aware of all the possible side effects ( i hate being sick - usually sick when having most things - although post surgeries I was fine). Getting my head around the hair loss ( my son gets married next year and had been growing it for posh updo) but wondered about microblading?? Has anyone had this for their eyebrows and is it something I could get done before the chemo??
Posts.Title: So anxious....

Posts.Content: Thank you ladies, your replies have given me some hope DD
Posts.Title: Hair returning - but should I get excited?

Posts.Content: A question on a similar theme. I have had 3 x FEC-T and am now about to have my 2nd Docetaxel and Herceptin with one further dose of both in three weeks time. I then continue on the Herceptin route for the rest of the year, when my hair starts to grow back any ideas how long it will take to look normal but short??? my son gets married in October and trying to prepare myself for how I will look. I dont want the day to be about me its all about them, but if I still look like I am recovering I want to have time to do something about it DD
Posts.Title: Hair returning - but should I get excited?
